pullRequest.body:
Generalise some lemmas about `NormedDivisionRing` to any normed ring satisfying `NormMulClass`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [5d9ef93a82](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23376/commits/5d9ef93a82890f945f61d36dc82c99e44efa7d0d)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +2.02% | `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Ring.Lemmas` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Ring.Lemmas | 1335 | 1362 | +27 (+2.02%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.NumberTheory.LegendreSymbol.GaussEisensteinLemmas` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.SumTwoSquares` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Zsqrtd.QuadraticReciprocity`</details>|2|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Polynomial` `Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousMap.Polynomial`|22|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Field.Instances`|26|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Ring.InfiniteSum` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Ring.Lemmas` `Mathlib.Analysis.NormedSpace.Int` `Mathlib.Topology.Bornology.BoundedOperation`</details>|27|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ Dilation.mulLeft`
`+ Dilation.mulRight`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Out of scope for this PR, but perhaps we should change this in a later pr to `ha : ‖a‖ ≠ 0` to make this work for `SeminormedRing`.
That should indeed be possible, but it's not 100% clear to me if the gain in generality is worth the loss of convenience in the main use-case of actually normed rings. Let's save it for later.
Does everything still work if you make this `NonUnital`?
I'm not entirely sure what this was trying to protect against, but maybe we should replace it with a weaker constraint rather than dropping it altogether. Are you able to track down who added it?

Oh, yes, I should have explained that. The current files `Normed/Ring/Lemmas` and `Normed/Field/Lemmas` were formerly one file which I split into two halves, and this anti-import constraint got copied into both (my mistake). Since `Normed/Field/Lemmas` imports `Normed/Ring/Lemmas`, it suffices to have it in the former.
... They aren't, it was just code copied verbatim from elsewhere.

a style nit, for consistency (and diff minimization)
```suggestion
def DilationEquiv.mulLeft (ha : a ≠ 0) : α ≃ᵈ α with
  __ := Dilation.mulLeft ha
  toEquiv := Equiv.mulLeft₀ a ha
```
and below
Did you intend to make `a` implicit here? I'd argue it should be explicit, to match `Equiv.mulLeft₀ a ha`

Yes, I did, because that is the usual mathlib rule: arguments which are inferrable from another explicit argument should be implicit. It is true that `Equiv.mulLeft₀` violates this, but doesn't that mean it is wrong and should be fixed?

pullRequest.title: feat(Analysis/Normed): generalize lemmas to NormMulClass
